titles.title: Gambling ATM and Credit/Debit Card Reform Act

To implement certain recommendations of the National Gambling Commission by prohibiting the placement of automated teller machines or any device by which an extension of credit or an electronic fund transfer may be initiated by a consumer in the immediate area in a gambling establishment where gambling or wagering takes place.

bill.summary: 9/8/1999--Introduced. Gambling ATM and Credit/Debit Card Reform Act - Amends the Electronic Fund Transfer Act and the Truth in Lending Act to prohibit in the immediate area of a gambling establishment where any form of gambling is going on: (1) the placement of electronic terminals (automated teller machines, or ATMs); and (2) acceptance of the use of a credit card by a consumer to initiate a consumer credit transaction. Makes violators of this prohibition liable to consumers for actual and punitive damages.
